MODULE.name: NativeToolbar
MODULE.HELP_OVERVIEW: The NativeToolbar method let you create and remove a toolbar at runtime.
MODULE.MORE_HELP:
Either Toolbar or Tabbar should be used in an application - Toolbar and Tabbar shouldnot be used simultaneously. ## Enabling the API This API is part of the `coreapi` extension that is included automatically. :::ruby extensions: ["coreapi"]
## JavaScript Usage Be sure to review the [JavaScript API Usage](/guide/api_js) guide for important information about using this API in JavaScript.
## Ruby Usage Be sure to review the [Ruby API Usage](/guide/api_ruby) guide for important information about using this API in Ruby.

METHOD.name: create
METHOD.DESC: Creates a new toolbar and removes the current toolbar and replaces it with this one. Any images used for UI elements should be specified by either an absolute path. i.e. '/sdcard/nmt/blabla.com.bla./data/public/img/button.png'

PARAM.name: toolbarElements
PARAM.DESC: Array of Toolbar elements. Do not create more than five elements for maximum portability.Toolbar elements are not scrollable, so if some buttons will not fit into the screen dimensions, they will be invisible.

PARAM.name: toolbarElement
PARAM.DESC: Properties of Toolbar elements. Either :icon or :label must be specified. If both are specified, :icon is drawn and :label is discarded.

PARAM.name: label
PARAM.DESC: Visible label to display instead of an icon.For predefined actions, icon will be displayed. Android, iOS note: for predefined actions no label will be displayed.

PARAM.name: action
PARAM.DESC: URL to call when button is pressed or special value.It may be path to Ruby controller action; i.e. '/app/Account' would load the Account index action. For ruby callback use 'callback:/app/Account' Or javascript method to call: 'javascript: methodOnButton();'.

VALUE.DESC: Add a separator to the toolbar. If only one separator is specified, then elements after separator will be right-aligned. If more then one separator is added: on WM/CE, platform dependent separator will be displayed, on Android/iOS center-aligned groups will be created.
Navigate to Settings page, defined in configuration file.
Navigate to Home page, defined in configuration file.
Perform back action or execute browser back.
Expand application window to full screen.
Display software keyboard window.Set `Rho.System.keyboardState` to `Rho.System.KEYBOARD_AUTOMATIC` to use this element.

PARAM.name: icon
PARAM.DESC: Relative path to toolbar item icon in your rhodes app (typically located in '/public/images/'). Icon is ignored for predefined actions, icon will be displayed even if no icon specified. iPhone and Android: Icons must be no more than 30x30 pixels and must be in .png format. Windows Mobile: Icons can be any size, but all icons should have same size (default - 48x48). .png and .bmp formats are supported.

PARAM.name: coloredIcon
PARAM.DESC: Use colored icon in toolbar on iPhone instead of standard monochrome white icon (prepared from image alpha).

PARAM.name: width
PARAM.DESC: Button width in pixel. Used to define separator width when more than one separator specified.

METHOD.name: remove
METHOD.DESC: Removes the current toolbar. Does nothing if there is no active toolbar.

MODULE.PLATFORM: WM, CE, Win32, Android, iOS, WP8
